text:
Keep in mind that we have been describing two distinct hypothesis tests, one about the
significance of the difference between the means of two populations and one about the
significance of the mean of the differences between pairs of observations. Here are rules
for when these tests may be applied:
The test of the differences in means is used when there are two independent samples.
A test of the significance of the mean of the differences between paired
observations is used when the samples are not independent.
